intro: Psychotria barbiflora, commonly known as the barbed-flower psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It often grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands. Psychotria barbiflora is also known for its alkaloid-rich seeds, which have been used in traditional medicine and rituals.
